place.name: BEDINGHAM
place.gazetteerText: BEDINGHAM, a parish in Loddon district, Norfolk; 4 miles NW of Bungay r. station. Post Town, Topcroft, under Bungay. Acres, 1,340. Real property, £2,471. Pop., 288.-Houses, 64. The property is divided among a few. Bedingham Hall is a chief residence. The living is a vicarage in the diocese of Norwich. Value, £150* Patrons, the Impropriators. The church is good. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
